001package tictactoe;
002
003/**
004 * Represents a 2D game board that can be edited.
005 * 
006 * @author Tapio Malmberg
007 */
008public class GameBoard extends ImmutableGameBoard {
009    /**
010     * Creates a new GameBoard with the given width and height.
011     * @param width the width of the game board, must be greater than zero
012     * @param height the height of the game board, must be greater than zero
013     */
014    public GameBoard(int width, int height) {
015        super(width, height);
016    }
017
018    /**
019     * Fills the whole game board with the given value.
020     * @param value the value that the game board will be filled with
021     */
022    public void fillBoard(int value) {
023        for (int x = 0; x < getWidth(); x++) {
024            for (int y = 0; y < getHeight(); y++) {
025                setPosition(x, y, value);
026            }
027        }
028    }
029
030    /**
031     * Sets the contents of the game board square at the given coordinate to {@code value}.
032     * @param pos the coordinate of the square to be changed
033     * @param value the value that the square will be set to
034     */
035    public void setPosition(Coordinate pos, int value) {
036        setPosition(pos.x, pos.y, value);
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * Sets the contents of the game board square at the given x, y coordinate to {@code value}.
041     * @param x the x value of the game board square
042     * @param y the y value of the game board square
043     * @param value the value that the square will be set to
044     */
045    public void setPosition(int x, int y, int value) {
046        board[y][x] = value;
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * Returns this game board as an immutable game board that cannot be edited.
051     * @return this game board as an immutable game board
052     */
053    public ImmutableGameBoard asImmutable() {
054        return new ImmutableGameBoard(this);
055    }
056}
